operations.name: at

operations.specification:
This operation creates a new employee comment record in the job_performance_eval_employee_comments table. The employee comment must include employee ID, evaluation cycle ID, and comment content.

Only users with role 'employee' are authorized to create employee comments.

Request Body: Data required to create an employee comment.
Response Body: Created employee comment information.
operations.description:
Create a new employee comment with required fields employee ID, evaluation cycle ID, and comment text.

Only accessible to users with role 'employee'.
operations.summary: Create a new employee comment

requestBody.description: Data required to create an employee comment

operations.name: create

operations.specification: This operation updates an existing employee comment record in the job_performance_eval_employee_comments table. The API allows changing the comment text of an employee's evaluation comment identified by a unique UUID. All required user permissions must be held by authenticated employees to perform this operation. The operation updates the comment content, and timestamps created_at and updated_at help audit the modification. This supports tracking employee qualitative feedback on their own evaluations for a specific evaluation cycle.
operations.description:
Update an existing employee comment by its unique ID.

This operation modifies the comment text of the employee comment record. The record is identified using the employee comment's unique UUID path parameter. The updated comment must comply with content length and format policies and is linked to an employee and an evaluation cycle in the database.

Only authenticated users with employee role authorization may perform this update. The operation ensures that the related audit fields such as updated_at are managed accordingly.

No other record fields such as employee ID or evaluation cycle ID can be changed using this method. The operation supports soft deletion logic internally but does not expose soft delete via API.

This API is integral for managing employee-submitted qualitative remarks within the Job Performance Evaluation service.
operations.summary: Update an employee comment by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the employee comment to update

requestBody.description: New content for the employee comment

operations.name: updateEmployeeComment

operations.specification: This operation deletes an existing employee comment record identified by the unique UUID in the job_performance_eval_employee_comments table. The deletion is a hard delete permanently removing the record from the database as no soft delete handling is exposed via this API. This is strictly available to users with employee role to manage their own comments. Once deleted, the deleted comment cannot be recovered via this API and must be handled through backup or audit logs if necessary.
operations.description:
Delete an employee comment by ID.

This operation permanently removes the employee comment record from the database, identified by the UUID path parameter.

Only users authenticated as employees can perform this deletion. Once deleted, the comment cannot be restored through this API.

This endpoint is critical for users managing their qualitative feedback and comments related to their evaluations within the system.
operations.summary: Delete an employee comment by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the employee comment to delete

operations.name: eraseEmployeeComment

operations.specification: This operation retrieves a paginated list of manager comments related to employee evaluations from the job_performance_eval_manager_comments table. It supports advanced filtering, searching, and pagination through the request body parameters allowing users to query comments by manager ID, evaluation cycle, date ranges, or keywords in comments. The response returns a paginated list of manager comment summaries optimized for client display. This API is available to users with manager role authorization as it handles sensitive evaluation feedback relevant to managerial functions.
operations.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of manager comments with filtering and search capabilities.

This operation allows querying manager comments by various criteria including manager ID, evaluation cycle, date ranges, and keywords. It supports sorting and pagination parameters in the request body.

The returned results are paginated and use a summary DTO for optimized client-side display.

Authorization is restricted to users with manager role due to the sensitive nature of managerial evaluation comments.

This API supports effective management and review of qualitative managerial feedback within the job performance evaluation system.
operations.summary: Search and paginate manager comments

requestBody.description: Search and filter criteria for manager comments

responseBody.description: Paginated list of manager comment summaries

operations.name: searchManagerComments

operations.specification: This operation retrieves a specific manager comment record by UUID from the job_performance_eval_manager_comments table. It returns detailed information about the manager comment, including the manager who authored it, related evaluation cycle, comment content, and audit timestamps. Access is limited to authorized manager users. This API supports viewing and verifying individual manager feedback records in the job performance evaluation system.
operations.description:
Retrieve detail of a manager comment by its unique ID.

This operation fetches the manager comment information identified by the UUID from the path parameter. It includes manager info, evaluation cycle linkage, comment content, and timestamps.

Access is limited to users with manager role authorization.

The operation does not allow modifications, only retrieval.

This API is essential for auditing and reviewing manager qualitative feedback on employee evaluations.
operations.summary: Retrieve a manager comment by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the manager comment to retrieve

operations.name: atManagerComment

operations.specification: This operation creates a new manager comment record in the job_performance_eval_manager_comments table. It stores qualitative text feedback from a manager about an employee in a specific evaluation cycle. The API requires the manager's ID, the evaluation cycle ID, and the comment content. Created and updated timestamps are set by the system, and soft deletion is supported via a nullable deleted_at column. This operation is used by managers to submit their evaluation comments for employees during evaluation periods.
operations.description:
Create a new manager comment linking a manager to an evaluation cycle with a textual comment. This API validates the manager's identity and requires a valid evaluation cycle. Manager comments provide qualitative insights complementing numeric evaluation scores.

Authorization is restricted to authenticated managers. The system automatically timestamps creation and updates, and supports soft deletion.

This operation corresponds to the job_performance_eval_manager_comments table described in the Prisma schema, which includes references to the manager and evaluation cycle entities along with comment content. The created record can later be retrieved or updated. Errors result from invalid foreign keys or missing required fields.
operations.summary: Create a manager comment for evaluation cycle

requestBody.description: Manager comment creation data

operations.name: create

operations.specification:
This operation updates an existing manager comment by ID in the job_performance_eval_manager_comments table. It allows modification of the comment content associated with a specific manager, linked to a particular evaluation cycle. The operation requires the comment ID as a path parameter and the updated comment data in the request body. Created and deleted timestamps are system-managed. The updated_at timestamp is refreshed on modification. Soft deletion support is maintained.

Managers can update their evaluation comments to reflect changes or corrections during the evaluation period. Access control ensures only authorized managers can modify their comments.

The operation relates specifically to records in job_performance_eval_manager_comments with the specified comment ID. It rejects invalid IDs or unauthorized attempts.
operations.description:
Update the text content of a manager comment identified by its ID. This API allows managers to revise their evaluation comments for employees during active evaluation cycles.

Authorization is limited to the comment author or authorized managers. Data integrity and soft deletion status are handled by the system.

The request requires the comment ID path parameter and the updated comment data in the request body. Successful update returns the updated record.
operations.summary: Update a manager comment by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the manager comment to update

requestBody.description: Updated manager comment data

operations.name: update

operations.specification:
This operation permanently deletes a manager comment from the job_performance_eval_manager_comments table identified by its unique ID. It removes the record entirely, so the comment is no longer retrievable unless restored from backup. The operation requires the manager comment ID as a path parameter. Soft deletion is logically supported by a nullable deleted_at column, but this API performs a hard delete.

Authorization is restricted to managers with appropriate permissions. Deletion is irreversible, so caution is advised.

This endpoint interacts with the job_performance_eval_manager_comments table, deleting comments associated with managers and evaluation cycles.
operations.description:
Delete a manager comment identified by its ID. This operation removes the record completely from the database.

Only authorized managers can delete comments, ensuring compliance and accountability.

The process does not return any content. Errors result from invalid IDs or authorization failures.
operations.summary: Delete a manager comment by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the manager comment to delete

operations.name: erase

operations.specification:
This operation retrieves a paginated list of evaluation snapshots representing historical job performance evaluations for employees. It supports filtering, sorting, and pagination to accommodate enterprise level evaluation history management and reporting. The operation references the job_performance_eval_evaluation_snapshots table storing combined employee self-evaluations and manager evaluations with scores, comments, and timestamps.

Clients use this operation to view historical evaluation data snapshots, enabling audit, trend analysis, and reporting.

Because evaluation snapshots are stable historical data, this endpoint is read-only and accessible to authorized roles such as managers and potentially HR. The operation accepts complex filtering, includes pagination parameters, and returns a paginated collection of evaluation snapshot summaries.

It involves related entities such as employees and evaluation cycles to provide rich historical context.
operations.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of job performance evaluation snapshots representing historical combined employee and manager evaluation data.

This operation allows filtering by evaluation cycle, employee, and other criteria using a flexible request body schema. Pagination and sorting improve usability for large datasets.

Authorization roles include managers who review evaluation histories for compliance, trend tracking, and HR decision making.

The response returns paginated evaluation snapshot summaries suitable for listing and detail exploration.
operations.summary: List paginated evaluation snapshots with filtering

requestBody.description: Filtering, pagination, and sorting parameters for evaluation snapshots

responseBody.description: Paginated list of evaluation snapshot summaries

operations.name: index

operations.specification: This operation retrieves a single job performance evaluation snapshot record by its unique identifier. It accesses the job_performance_eval_evaluation_snapshots table, which contains historical snapshots of employee self-evaluations and manager evaluations for a specific evaluation cycle. The snapshot stores both employee and manager scores for performance, knowledge, problem-solving, and innovation, along with optional comments. This endpoint is used to fetch detailed evaluation snapshot data for reporting and audit purposes.
operations.summary: Retrieve a specific job performance evaluation snapshot by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the evaluation snapshot to retrieve

operations.name: at
operations.description:
Retrieve a detailed snapshot of job performance evaluation for a specific evaluation record identified by its unique ID. This snapshot includes both employee self-assessment and manager evaluation scores across multiple categories such as work performance, knowledge/skills, problem-solving and collaboration, and innovation.

The operation retrieves data from the job_performance_eval_evaluation_snapshots table, which serves as an immutable historical record for evaluations conducted during specific evaluation cycles. It includes timestamps and supports soft deletion for logical record management.

Security considerations require that only authorized users such as HR personnel, managers, or administrators access this detailed data. Proper validation of the snapshot ID is necessary to avoid invalid or unauthorized data access.

This operation returns the full detailed evaluation snapshot, useful for report generation, historical analysis, and audit compliance. No request body is required as this is a read-only GET operation. Errors such as not found or unauthorized access should be handled at the application layer.

operations.specification: This operation provides a paginated search and filter interface for retrieving aggregated team-level statistics of job performance evaluations. It interacts with the job_performance_eval_team_statistics table that stores average evaluation scores per evaluation cycle and organizational team unit. This endpoint supports complex queries including filtering by evaluation cycle, team, date ranges, and sorting, enabling HR and management to monitor team performance trends effectively.

operations.name: index
operations.description:
Search and retrieve aggregated team statistics from job performance evaluations. Users can apply various filters such as evaluation cycle, organizational team, and date ranges, and receive paginated results sorted by score averages or evaluation counts.

The data source is the job_performance_eval_team_statistics table which contains average scores across performance categories and evaluation counts. This data supports management and HR in assessing team-level evaluation outcomes over time.

Security requires role-based access control; typically, only HR, managers, or administrators can perform this search.

The request body supports complex query conditions, including pagination parameters to control result size and sorting options. The response includes team statistics summaries for each team matching the criteria.

access.description:
JWT access token for authenticated requests.

This token should be included in the Authorization header for subsequent
authenticated API requests as `Bearer {token}`.

refresh.description:
Refresh token for obtaining new access tokens.

This token can be used to request new access tokens when the current access
token expires, extending the user's session.

expired_at.description:
Access token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating when the access token will expire and
can no longer be used for authentication.

refreshable_until.description:
Refresh token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating the latest time until which the
refresh token can be used to obtain new access tokens.

IAuthorizationToken.description:
Authorization token response structure.

This interface defines the structure of the authorization token response
returned after successful user authentication. It contains both access and
refresh tokens along with their expiration information.

This token structure is automatically included in API schemas when the system
detects authorization roles in the requirements analysis phase. It provides a
standard format for JWT-based authentication across the generated backend
applications.

Manager identity and authentication information for the Job Performance
Evaluation service. Includes email, password hash for login, full name,
and temporal audit fields. Unique email ensures distinct manager
accounts. Supports soft delete with deleted_at. This table is a primary
business entity for manager users who supervise employees.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier for the employee.

email.description: Employee's unique email address used for login and notifications.

created_at.description:
Record creation timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string when the record was created.

updated_at.description:
Record last update timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string for last update time.

deleted_at.description:
Timestamp when record was soft deleted, NULL if active.

ISO 8601 date-time string or null if the record is active.

IJobPerformanceEvalEmployees.description:
Employee entity representing basic employee information in the system.

Includes unique email, name, timestamps, and soft deletion support.

email.description:
Employee's unique email address used for login and notifications.

Must follow the format of a valid email.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password for authentication. Never store plaintext passwords.

Must be a secure hash value.

name.description:
Employee's full name.

Used for display and identification in the system.

deleted_at.description:
Timestamp when record was soft deleted, NULL if active.

Used for logical deletion and audit purposes.

IJobPerformanceEvalEmployee.IUpdate.description:
Input type for updating existing Employee information.

Allows partial updates of mutable fields like email, password hash, and name.

The 'deleted_at' field supports logical deletion and must be nullable.

oneOf.description:
Name or partial name to search managers.

Can be null to indicate no filter.

search.description:
Name or partial name to search managers.

Can be null to indicate no filter.

page.description:
Page number for pagination.

Optional; defaults to 1.

limit.description:
Number of items per page.

Optional; defaults to 20.

oneOf.description:
Sort criteria.

Could be null or string representing field and order, e.g., "name_asc".

sort.description:
Sort criteria.

Could be null or string representing field and order, e.g., "name_asc".

email.description:
Manager's unique email address used for login and notifications.

Must follow the format of a valid email.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password for authentication. Passwords are never stored in plaintext.

Must be a secure hash value.

name.description:
Manager's full name.

Used for display and identification in the system.

deleted_at.description:
Soft delete timestamp; if null, record is active.

Used for logical deletion and audit purposes.

IJobPerformanceEvalManager.IUpdate.description:
Input type for updating manager information.

Allows partial updates to email, password hash, name, and logical deletion timestamp.

code.description:
Filter by unique job group code.

This property is expected to be a string uniquely identifying a job group.
It is a required property in the search request to narrow down the search.

name.description:
Filter by name pattern.

Optional pattern or keyword filter to search job groups by name.
If not used, can be explicitly set to null.

createdAfter.description:
Minimum creation date filter.

Optional ISO 8601 formatted date-time string to filter job groups created after this date.
Use explicit null if no value is provided.

createdBefore.description:
Maximum creation date filter.

Optional ISO 8601 formatted date-time string to filter job groups created before this date.
Use explicit null if no value is provided.

page.description:
Pagination page number.

Optional unsigned integer indicating the page number for paginated results.
Use explicit null if no value is provided.

limit.description:
Number of records per page.

Optional unsigned integer limiting the number of items per page.
Use explicit null if no value is provided.

sortKey.description:
Sort key for the paginated results.

Optional string specifying the attribute name to sort by, such as 'name' or 'created_at'.
Use explicit null if not sorting.

sortOrder.description:
Sort order direction.

Optional string with allowed values 'asc' or 'desc' to define sort order.
Use explicit null if no sorting order.

IJobPerformanceEvalJobGroups.IRequest.description: Search criteria and pagination parameters for job groups

code.description:
Unique code identifying the job group.

This property represents the unique identifier code for the job group, used
throughout the organizational hierarchy to categorize broad job families.
It is a required string value expected to uniquely represent each job group in the system.

name.description:
Name of the job group.

The display name of the job group used in user interfaces and reports.
It is a required string field that must accurately reflect the job family name.

description.description:
Detailed description of the job group.

This optional field provides additional context or explanations regarding the job group.
It may include organizational notes or relevant information to further describe the group.
This field can be null if no description is provided.

created_at.description:
Record creation timestamp.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string indicating when this record was created.
This is a read-only field managed by the system.

updated_at.description:
Record last update timestamp.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string indicating the last time this record was updated.
This is a read-only timestamp maintained by the system.

IJobPerformanceEvalJobGroup.description:
Job Group entity representing the highest-level job classification in the organizational hierarchy.

It includes identifying properties such as unique code and name, and may contain descriptive
information for HR and administrative purposes.

Timestamps for creation and update are recorded for audit and change tracking.

This entity is a fundamental part of the job hierarchy management in the Job Performance Evaluation service.

code.description:
Unique code identifying the job group.

Required field for creating a new job group. Must be unique in the system.

name.description:
Name of the job group.

Required friendly name of the job group.

description.description:
Detailed description of the job group.

Optional descriptive text about this job group.

IJobPerformanceEvalJobGroup.ICreate.description: Request type to create a new job group.

code.description:
Unique code identifying the job group.

Optional field. Updating code must maintain uniqueness.

name.description:
Name of the job group.

Optional field. Represents the display name.

description.description:
Detailed description of the job group.

Optional descriptive text.

IJobPerformanceEvalJobGroup.IUpdate.description: Request type to update an existing job group.

code.description: Optional filter for job series code

name.description: Optional filter for job series name, supports partial matching

description.description: Optional filter for job series description

limit.description: Optional limit of records per page

IJobPerformanceEvalJobSeries.IRequest.description: Request parameters for searching and paginating job series.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the job series.

Format: UUID string.

job_group_id.description:
Identifier of the parent job group.

code.description: Unique code representing the job series.

name.description: The name of the job series.

description.description: Optional detailed description of the job series.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the record was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the record was last updated.

deleted_at.description: Optional timestamp for soft deletion.

IJobPerformanceEvalJobSeries.description:
Job Series represents the mid-level job classification under a job group.

It helps segment job roles into more specific clusters. This model
references the parent job group and is essential for maintaining job
hierarchy.

code.description: Unique code for the job series

description.description: Optional detailed description

IJobPerformanceEvalJobSeries.ICreate.description: Request payload to create a new job series entity.

job_group_id.description: Optional updated parent job group's UUID

code.description: Optional updated unique code

description.description: Optional updated description

deleted_at.description: Optional soft delete timestamp

id.description: Unique identifier for the job role.

code.description: Unique code for the job role.

description.description: Optional long description about the job role.

created_at.description: Record creation timestamp.

updated_at.description: Record last update timestamp.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp.

IJobPerformanceEvalJobRole.description:
Job Role represents the specific job function within a job series. It
encapsulates roles employees occupy and links to job series for
hierarchical clarity. This model is the base for assignments and
evaluations.

job_series_id.description: Optional filter by Job Series ID.

code.description: Optional filter by unique job role code.

name.description: Optional filter by job role name.

Request parameters for querying job roles

job_series_id.description:
Parent Job Series ID.

Required UUID string.

code.description: Unique code identifying the job role.

description.description:
Description of the job role.

Optional.

Request body structure for creating a new job role

Includes fields identifying the parent job series, unique code, name, and optional descriptions and growth level.

job_series_id.description:
Parent Job Series ID.

Optional; only if update of parent link allowed.
Typically omit or leave null.

code.description: Unique code identifying job role.

description.description: Description of the job role.

IJobPerformanceEvalJobRole.IUpdate.description:
Request body structure for updating an existing job role

job_role_id.description: Optional filter criteria to fetch task groups linked with specified job role IDs.

IJobPerformanceEvalTaskGroup.description:
Task Group organizes related tasks under job roles for better management
and categorization. It groups tasks logically and serves as a parent for
tasks.

job_role_id.description: The job role ID this task group belongs to.

code.description: Unique code for the task group.

description.description: Optional description for additional details.

description.description: Optional description for additional details.

code.description: Unique code for the task.

description.description: Optional detailed description.

Task Activity specifies detailed actionable activities within tasks. It

IJobPerformanceEvalSelfEvaluation.description:
Represents an employee's self-evaluation record including scores and comments.

This entity tracks evaluation cycles and associates scores with employees for performance management.

The evaluation cycle ID this evaluation belongs to.

@format uuid

work_performance_score.description: Score for Work Performance Level evaluation, in scale 1-5.

knowledge_skill_score.description: Score for Knowledge/Skill evaluation, in scale 1-5.

problem_solving_collab_score.description: Score for Problem Solving and Collaboration evaluation, in scale 1-5.

innovation_score.description: Score for Innovation evaluation, in scale 1-5.

overall_comment.description:
Comprehensive comment by the employee on the evaluation.

Mandatory for submission.

The evaluation cycle ID this evaluation belongs to.

work_performance_score.description: Score for Work Performance Level evaluation, in scale 1-5.

knowledge_skill_score.description: Score for Knowledge/Skill evaluation, in scale 1-5.

problem_solving_collab_score.description: Score for Problem Solving and Collaboration evaluation, in scale 1-5.

innovation_score.description: Score for Innovation evaluation, in scale 1-5.

overall_comment.description: Comprehensive comment by the employee on the evaluation.

evaluation_date_to.description: Filter for evaluation date up to this ISO 8601 date-time.

Sort direction, either ascending (asc) or descending (desc).

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerEvaluation.IRe.description: Criteria to search and paginate manager evaluations. All filter properties are optional.

id.description: Primary Key identifier of the manager evaluation record.

employee_id.description: Unique identifier of the employee being evaluated.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: Unique identifier of the evaluation cycle.

evaluation_date.description: The date when the evaluation was performed, in ISO 8601 format.

work_performance_score.description: Manager's score for work performance level, on a scale from 1 to 5.

knowledge_skill_score.description: Manager's score for knowledge and skill evaluation, on a scale from 1 to 5.

problem_solving_collab_score.description: Manager's score for problem solving and collaboration, on a scale from 1 to 5.

innovation_score.description: Manager's score for innovation, on a scale from 1 to 5.

overall_comment.description: A comprehensive comment by the manager on the evaluation.

created_at.description: Timestamp of record creation.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of last record update.

deleted_at.description: Optional soft delete timestamp; null if not deleted.

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerEvaluation.description: Represents detailed manager evaluation for an employee's job performance in a specific evaluation cycle, including scores and comprehensive comment.

manager_id.description: Identifier of the manager performing the evaluation.

employee_id.description: Identifier of the employee being evaluated.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: Identifier of the relevant evaluation cycle.

evaluation_date.description: Date when the evaluation is performed.

work_performance_score.description: Work performance score given by the manager (1-5).

knowledge_skill_score.description: Knowledge and skill score given by the manager (1-5).

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerEvaluation.ICr.description: Payload to create a new manager evaluation record including all mandatory fields.

manager_id.description: (Optional) Identifier of the manager performing the evaluation.

employee_id.description: (Optional) Identifier of the employee being evaluated.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: (Optional) Identifier of the relevant evaluation cycle.

evaluation_date.description: (Optional) Date when the evaluation is performed.

work_performance_score.description: (Optional) Work performance score given by the manager (1-5).

knowledge_skill_score.description: (Optional) Knowledge and skill score given by the manager (1-5).

deleted_at.description: Optional soft delete timestamp; null if not deleted.

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerEvaluation.IUp.description: Payload to update an existing manager evaluation record. All fields are optional to allow partial updates.

IJobPerformanceEvalEvaluationScore.IRequ.description:
Request parameters for querying and filtering evaluation scores with pagination.

Supports filtering on evaluation_id, category, score range, and sorting directions.

Paging parameters page and limit control the result set size and offset.

evaluation_id.description: Filter scores by associated evaluation ID

category.description: Evaluation category name to filter on. E.g., 'work_performance', 'knowledge_skill'

min_score.description: Minimum score value filter. Inclusive. 1 to 5 scale.

max_score.description: Maximum score value filter. Inclusive. 1 to 5 scale.

page.description: Page number for paginated results. Nullable.

limit.description: Limit of records per page. Nullable.

order_by.description: Property name used to sort records.

order_direction.description: Sorting direction for the order_by property.

IJobPerformanceEvalEvaluationScore.ICrea.description:
Request body schema to create a new evaluation score record.

Includes evaluation ID, category name, and score value in 1 to 5 scale.

Properties created_at and updated_at are system managed and omitted in create requests.

evaluation_id.description: Reference ID of the parent evaluation (self or manager evaluation)

category.description: Category name of the evaluation score, e.g., 'work_performance', 'knowledge_skill'

score.description: Score value assigned in the evaluation category, expected 1 to 5 inclusive.

IJobPerformanceEvalEvaluationScore.IUpda.description:
Request body schema to update an evaluation score record partially.

Allows modifying category name and score value. All fields are optional.

Properties evaluation_id, created_at, and updated_at are system managed and not included for update.

category.description: Category name of the evaluation score, e.g., 'work_performance', 'knowledge_skill'

score.description: Score value assigned in the evaluation category, expected 1 to 5 inclusive.

IJobPerformanceEvalEvaluationScore.description:
Represents a job performance evaluation score record linked to a specific evaluation (self or manager evaluation).

Captures category and score details stored in the database along with audit timestamps.

This schema is used for both input and output of evaluation score data in various API endpoints.

id.description: Primary key unique identifier of the evaluation score record

evaluation_id.description: Reference to either self or manager evaluation this score belongs to

category.description: Category name of the evaluation score, e.g., 'work_performance', 'knowledge_skill'

score.description: Integer score value from 1 to 5 representing the evaluation result

created_at.description: Timestamp when the record was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the record was last updated

search.description:
Search keyword to filter employee comments by full text search or similar matching.

Optional property to filter comments containing the keyword.

employee_id.description:
Filter by employee ID to retrieve comments made by a specific employee.

Optional UUID filter for employee.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
Filter by evaluation cycle ID to get comments associated with a specific evaluation period.

Optional UUID filter for evaluation cycle.

page.description:
Pagination parameter: page number to fetch.

Optional. If not specified, may default to 1.

limit.description:
Pagination parameter: number of records per page.

Optional. Defaults to a sensible limit like 100 if not set.

IJobPerformanceEvalEmployeeComments.IReq.description: Request parameters for searching and paginating employee comments.

id.description: Primary Key.

employee_id.description:
Belonged employee who authored the comment. {@link job_performance_eval_employees.id}.

UUID of the employee who made the comment.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
Related evaluation cycle of the comment. {@link job_performance_eval_evaluation_cycles.id}.

UUID of the evaluation cycle linked to this comment.

comment.description:
Content of the employee's comment on their evaluation.

This property contains the actual qualitative feedback or remarks provided by the employee regarding their evaluation.

It is a free text comment that can include detailed descriptions, insights, or opinions about their performance.

It is expected to be a reasonably sized text field.

created_at.description:
Timestamp of when the comment was created.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string indicating when this comment record was created.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp of when the comment was last updated.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string indicating the last modification time of this record.

IJobPerformanceEvalEmployeeComments.description: Employee comments on their own performance evaluations, capturing qualitative feedback distinct from numeric scores. Linked to the employee making the comment and to the evaluation cycle. Provides contextual insights into employee perceptions and subjective assessment. Includes timestamps for creation and update tracking. This table is a primary business entity for independent CRUD operations on employee comments.

employee_id.description:
UUID of the employee creating the comment.

Required to associate the comment with employee.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
UUID of the evaluation cycle this comment is related to.

Required to reference evaluation timeframe.

comment.description:
The content of the employee's comment.

Required free text field.

IJobPerformanceEvalEmployeeComments.ICre.description: Request payload for creating a new employee comment.

comment.description:
The content of the employee's comment.

Optional property to modify the comment text.

IJobPerformanceEvalEmployeeComments.IUpd.description: Request payload for updating an employee comment. Only comment text can be changed.

page.description:
Page number.

Optional pagination parameter to specify which page of results to fetch.

manager_id.description:
Filter property: Manager ID.

Optional UUID string used to filter comments by a specific manager.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
Filter property: Evaluation Cycle ID.

Optional UUID string used to filter comments by evaluation cycle.

comment.description:
Search text filter.

Optional full text search string to query comment content.

orderBy.description:
Sort order specification.

Optional string indicating sorting field and direction.

Example: 'created_at_DESC'

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerComments.IRequ.description:
Request parameters for searching and paginating manager comments.

Includes page number, limit of records per page, filtering by manager ID,
by evaluation cycle ID, full text search on comment content, and sort order.

Nullable fields allow for flexible querying.

id.description: Primary Key.

manager_id.description:
Manager who authored the comment. {@link job_performance_eval_managers.id}.

Unique identifier (UUID) of the manager who wrote this comment.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: Linked evaluation cycle for the comment. {@link job_performance_eval_evaluation_cycles.id}.

comment.description:
Content of the manager's comment on the employee's evaluation.

This comment contains qualitative feedback from the manager regarding an employee's evaluation during a specific evaluation cycle.
The content should be descriptive yet concise, providing meaningful context.

created_at.description:
Timestamp marking when the comment was created.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string indicating when this record was initially created.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp marking last update time of the comment.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string indicating the last time this comment was modified.

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerComments.description: Manager comments on employee performance evaluations, providing qualitative feedback separate from numeric evaluation scores. Linked to the manager who authored the comment and the specific evaluation cycle. Enables managerial insights and contextual remarks. Includes creation and update timestamps for audit and tracking. This table is a primary business entity allowing independent management of manager comments.

manager_id.description:
Manager who authored the comment. The UUID must correspond to an existing manager.

This field associates the comment with its author.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
Linked evaluation cycle ID to which this comment pertains.

This connects the comment to a specific performance evaluation period.

comment.description:
Content of the manager's comment.

This is a required textual content field where the manager inputs qualitative feedback.
Should respect size constraints and business rules for comments.

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerComments.ICrea.description: Request format for creating a new manager comment.

manager_id.description:
Manager who authored the comment. UUID of the manager.

This field may be optional or required depending on update policies but is defined here optional.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
Evaluation cycle ID to which this comment belongs.

Optional field to update linkage to evaluation cycle.

comment.description:
Content of the comment.

Enables managers to revise their feedback.

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerComments.IUpda.description: Request format for updating an existing manager comment.

page.description: Page number to retrieve, used for paginated results.

limit.description: Maximum number of records to return per page.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: UUID of the evaluation cycle to filter results.

employee_id.description: UUID of the employee to filter results.

created_after.description: Return records created after this ISO 8601 date-time.

created_before.description: Return records created before this ISO 8601 date-time.

filter.description: Filters object to narrow down result set based on criteria.

orderBy.description: Field name to order the results by, e.g., created_at.

IJobPerformanceEvalEvaluationSnapshots.I.description: Request payload for paginated retrieval of evaluation snapshots.

id.description: Unique UUID identifier for the evaluation snapshot.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: UUID of the evaluation cycle this snapshot belongs to.

employee_id.description: UUID of the employee associated with this snapshot.

performance_score.description: Employee's self-evaluated job performance score, 1 to 5.

knowledge_score.description: Employee's self-evaluated knowledge and skills score, 1 to 5.

problem_solving_score.description: Employee's self-evaluated problem solving and collaboration score, 1 to 5.

manager_performance_score.description: Manager's evaluation of job performance score, 1 to 5, nullable if unavailable.

manager_comment.description: Comprehensive comment provided by the manager, nullable.

created_before.description: Include records created before this ISO 8601 date-time.

IJobPerformanceEvalKnowledgeArea.ISummar.description:
Summary information of a knowledge area used for categorizing domains of expertise relevant to job tasks. This includes essential fields for identification and display.

Properties:
- id: Unique UUID
- code: Unique code string
- name: Descriptive name

This summary type omits detailed description and timestamps for brevity and UI efficiency.

id.description: Unique identifier of the self-evaluation record.

employee_id.description: UUID of the employee who submitted the self-evaluation.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: UUID of the evaluation cycle this evaluation belongs to.

evaluation_date.description: Date and time when the self-evaluation was performed.

work_performance_score.description: Score for Work Performance Level evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

knowledge_skill_score.description: Score for Knowledge and Skill evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

problem_solving_collab_score.description: Score for Problem Solving and Collaboration evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

innovation_score.description: Score for Innovation evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

IJobPerformanceEvalSelfEvaluation.ISumma.description:
Summary of an employee's self-evaluation including all scored categories but excluding the overall comment and audit timestamps.

Properties include:
- id: Evaluation UUID
- employee_id: UUID of employee
- evaluation_cycle_id: UUID of the evaluation cycle
- evaluation_date: Date of evaluation
- Category scores for each evaluation criterion

This summary excludes extensive details to allow efficient list rendering.

id.description: Unique identifier for manager evaluation record.

manager_id.description: UUID of the manager who performed the evaluation.

employee_id.description: UUID of the employee being evaluated.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: UUID of the evaluation cycle.

evaluation_date.description: Date and time when the evaluation was recorded.

work_performance_score.description: Manager's score for Work Performance Level evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

knowledge_skill_score.description: Manager's score for Knowledge and Skill evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

problem_solving_collab_score.description: Manager's score for Problem Solving and Collaboration evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

innovation_score.description: Manager's score for Innovation evaluation on a scale from 1 to 5.

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerEvaluation.ISu.description:
Summary of a manager's evaluation of an employee for a given evaluation cycle. Contains scores for all evaluation categories but excludes the overall comment and timestamps.

Properties included:
- id: Evaluation UUID
- manager_id: UUID of the manager
- employee_id: UUID of the employee
- evaluation_cycle_id: UUID of the cycle
- evaluation_date: Date of the evaluation
- Category scores for evaluation criteria

This summary is used for display in administrative lists and reports.

id.description: Unique identifier for the employee comment record.

employee_id.description: UUID of the employee who authored the comment.

evaluation_cycle_id.description: UUID of the evaluation cycle related to the comment.

comment.description: Content of the employee's comment regarding their evaluation.

IJobPerformanceEvalEmployeeComments.ISum.description:
Summary of an employee's comment on their job performance evaluation.

Includes:
- id: Unique UUID
- employee_id: UUID of commenting employee
- evaluation_cycle_id: UUID of related evaluation cycle
- comment: Actual comment text

This summary streamlines comment information for list displays without timestamps.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier for the manager comment entry.

comment.description:
Content of the manager's comment on the employee's evaluation.

This property contains qualitative feedback provided by the manager as part of job performance evaluations.

created_at.description:
Timestamp marking when the comment was created.

Used for audit and chronological record-keeping purposes.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp marking last update time of the comment.

Reflects the most recent modification to the comment content.

IJobPerformanceEvalManagerComments.ISumm.description:
Summary information of manager comments for list displays.

Includes unique ID, comment text, and timestamps for creation and last update.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier of the evaluation snapshot record.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
Referenced evaluation cycle's unique ID.

Links this snapshot to a specific evaluation period.

employee_id.description:
Referenced employee's unique ID.

Indicates which employee this snapshot belongs to.

performance_score.description:
Employee's self-evaluated job performance score.

Scale: 1 to 5, with 1 being the lowest and 5 the highest.

knowledge_score.description:
Employee's self-evaluated knowledge and skills score.

Scale: 1 to 5.

problem_solving_score.description:
Employee's self-evaluated problem solving and collaboration score.

Scale: 1 to 5.

innovation_score.description:
Employee's self-evaluated innovation score.

Scale: 1 to 5.

manager_performance_score.description:
Manager's evaluation of job performance score.

Scale: 1 to 5.

Optional; null if manager has not yet evaluated this category.

manager_knowledge_score.description:
Manager's evaluation of knowledge and skills score.

Scale: 1 to 5.

Optional; null if manager has not yet evaluated this category.

manager_problem_solving_score.description:
Manager's evaluation of problem solving and collaboration score.

Scale: 1 to 5.

Optional; null if manager has not yet evaluated this category.

manager_innovation_score.description:
Manager's evaluation of innovation score.

Scale: 1 to 5.

Optional; null if manager has not yet evaluated this category.

created_at.description:
Snapshot creation timestamp.

Records when this snapshot was first created.

updated_at.description:
Snapshot last update timestamp.

Indicates the latest modification time.

IJobPerformanceEvalEvaluationSnapshots.I.description:
Summary of job performance evaluation snapshots.

Includes key scores and references with timestamps for overview listing.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier for the team statistics record.

evaluation_cycle_id.description:
Referenced evaluation cycle's unique ID.

Links the record to a defined evaluation period.

team_id.description:
Organizational team identifier.

Used to distinguish team-level statistics.

average_performance_score.description:
Average job performance score for the team during the evaluation cycle.

Computed as the mean of individual employee scores.

average_knowledge_score.description: Average knowledge and skills score for the team during the evaluation cycle.

average_problem_solving_score.description: Average problem solving and collaboration score for the team during the evaluation cycle.

average_innovation_score.description: Average innovation score for the team during the evaluation cycle.

evaluation_count.description: Number of individual evaluations included in the team's statistics.

created_at.description:
Record creation timestamp.

Indicates when the statistics record was created.

updated_at.description:
Record last update timestamp.

Indicates the latest update time.

IJobPerformanceEvalTeamStatistic.ISummar.description:
Summary information of team statistics for job performance evaluations.

Includes average scores and evaluation count for quick reference.

Multi-actor authentication setup: 
This join operation (post /auth/employee/join) is required to establish a 'employee' role user account in the system. 
                  This scenario involves multiple authorization roles, requiring separate user accounts for each role to properly test cross-role interactions and authorization boundaries. 
                  The join operation creates the foundational user identity that will be used throughout the test scenario for 'employee' specific operations.
                  This join operation is required for the 'employee' role authentication.

Role switching authentication: 
This login operation (post /auth/employee/login) enables dynamic user role switching during test execution for the 'employee' role. 
                  In scenarios with multiple actors, the test agent needs to authenticate as different users to simulate real-world multi-user interactions. 
                  This login operation ensures proper session management and authorization context switching, allowing the test to validate permissions, access controls, and business logic that span across different user roles within a single test scenario.
                  This login operation may be required for user role swapping between multiple actors.

2. Create a new evaluation cycle using the manager authentication context (via /auth/manager/join and category creation if needed).
3. Create a self-evaluation record linked to the employee and evaluation cycle.
4. Update the self-evaluation record by changing the scores and overall comment using the PUT /jobPerformanceEval/employee/selfEvaluations/{id} endpoint.
5. Validate that the updated information is correctly persisted and accessible.

This test verifies the successful update flow of employee self-evaluation with all required IDs and proper authentication contexts.

Create a self-evaluation record for the created employee and evaluation cycle before updating it.

Multi-actor authentication setup: 
This join operation (post /auth/employee/join) is required to establish a 'employee' role user account in the system. 
                  This scenario involves multiple authorization roles, requiring separate user accounts for each role to properly test cross-role interactions and authorization boundaries. 
                  The join operation creates the foundational user identity that will be used throughout the test scenario for 'employee' specific operations.
                  This join operation is required for the 'employee' role authentication.

Role switching authentication: 
This login operation (post /auth/employee/login) enables dynamic user role switching during test execution for the 'employee' role. 
                  In scenarios with multiple actors, the test agent needs to authenticate as different users to simulate real-world multi-user interactions. 
                  This login operation ensures proper session management and authorization context switching, allowing the test to validate permissions, access controls, and business logic that span across different user roles within a single test scenario.
                  This login operation may be required for user role swapping between multiple actors.

scenario.draft:
This scenario tests successful deletion of a job role by an employee user. Includes creating an employee user to establish authentication context, creating a manager user to create job group and job series, creating a job role under the job series, then deleting the job role.

Steps:
1. Create employee user, establish authentication context.
2. Create manager user, create job group.
3. Create job series under job group.
4. Create job role under job series.
5. Switch authentication back to employee.
6. Delete the job role using /jobPerformanceEval/employee/jobSeries/{jobSeriesId}/jobRoles/{jobRoleId}.

Ensures authorized job role deletion with proper data preparation and context switching.

scenario.draft: This test scenario covers the successful deletion of a job series under a specific job group by a manager user. The flow starts with creating a manager user and establishing the authentication context via /auth/manager/join. Then, the manager creates a job group using /jobPerformanceEval/manager/jobGroups endpoint and obtains jobGroupId. Next, the manager creates a job series under that job group via /jobPerformanceEval/manager/jobGroups/{jobGroupId}/jobSeries, obtaining jobSeriesId. Finally, using the manager authentication context, the test calls DELETE /jobPerformanceEval/manager/jobGroups/{jobGroupId}/jobSeries/{jobSeriesId} to delete the created job series successfully. This scenario validates proper cascading dependencies, role-based access control for resource deletion, and ensures that the job group and job series entities exist before the deletion operation. It also covers backend handling of entity deletions and confirms response status for successful deletion.
